dspace-development.title: Create DataSpace Collections for the Police Perspectives Guidebook Series

comments.body:
The Collections for the West Virginia Historical Society were created within the following sub-community:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/131787362-13c49e27-a48c-43cf-b0c2-c3999db67276.png)

The following Sub-communities were created:

* West Virginia Historical Society: https://dataspace.princeton.edu/handle/88435/dsp01xg94hs66m

The following Collections were created:

* Police Perspectives Guidebook Series: https://dataspace.princeton.edu/handle/88435/dsp01v979v6209
* Rhode Island History Journal: https://dataspace.princeton.edu/handle/88435/dsp01qj72pb26p

figgy.title: "no entries found" when users change a collection title, save, and then click "view all XX items in this collection" within the collection record

comments.body: To be clear, this is definitely a bug, I just don't know how I'd want to fix it. We'd have to reindex all collection members for this kind of metadata change, which would be slow enough we'd have to background it.

lib_jobs.title: Adding a way to process users in a CSV

orangelight.title: Prevents the no holdings display when there electronic access links
Exporting Bookmarks as a CSV returns the wrong ID number
Export bookmarks to csv with id wrapped in single quotes

comments.body: @escowles if you have time

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/42611503/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/42611503)

Coverage increased (+0.004%) to 97.066% when pulling **f9d0ec39db7385bebadd5523128f2371c7a5cdda on 2695-export-csv-bookmarks-update** into **a360d7b4f0d93fda7c33990f8de3dbc58ce49bbb on main**.
Issue can be reproduced on this record: https://catalog.princeton.edu/catalog/9999462633506421
Not sure if there is anything to be done given the constraints on the search results availability.

The Online was not added because we wanted to avoid the deep=true in the search results. It would slow down the response a lot. 
The assumption was that the students know that a resource is on cdl and would not be confused by seeing the 'Unavailable'. 
If we index the work order info from cdl as we have discussed in the past then we can display the indexed info from the work order and avoid calling the api for the cdl availability display. 
Until then it would be nice to let the students know that the cdl item is there even if the search results page displays 'Unavailable'.

comments.body: See also https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/issues/2711

See https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/pull/1572 for work done in bibdata to display "On-site" access for Aeon location. See also https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/pull/2667 for work done to display custom status values for Marquand items.

Location codes that we should look for:

pulfalight.title: Updates the biographical collection note layout

comments.body:
I am sorry for the delay with this, I am currently experiencing the following recurring error:

```bash
I, [2021-09-02T10:15:07.798679 #75113]  INFO -- : Regenerated AC259
rake aborted!
MultiXml::ParseError: 96:6604686: FATAL: Premature end of data in tag c line 96
[...]/pulfalight/app/services/aspace_fixture_generator.rb:179:in `get_content'
```
What's after AC259? That looks like maybe an EAD with ruby errors in it is coming out?

I'm going to try and restart my environment, I'm receiving this:

```bash
$ curl -H "X-ArchivesSpace-Session: $SESSION" "https://aspace-staging.princeton.edu/staff/api/repositories/3/resource_descriptions/1769"
{"error":"Sinatra::NotFound"}
```

These IDs were parsed by debugging through the Ruby code base.

I apologize, I am still having this problem, it appears to just affect `MC016`:

```
170: def fixture_files
    171:   @fixture_files ||=
    172:     begin
    173:       #ead_ids.lazy.map do |eadid|
    174:       ['MC016'].lazy.map do |eadid|
    175:         binding.pry
[1] pry(#<AspaceFixtureGenerator>)> eadid
=> "MC016"
[2] pry(#<AspaceFixtureGenerator>)> uri, repo_code = client.ead_url_for_eadid(eadid: eadid)&.first
=> ["repositories/3/resource_descriptions/1769", "publicpolicy"]
[3] pry(#<AspaceFixtureGenerator>)> uri, repo_code = client.ead_url_for_eadid(eadid: eadid)
=> {"repositories/3/resource_descriptions/1769"=>"publicpolicy"}
```

The `client` here is configured for the staging environment:

```
=> #<Aspace::Client:0x00007f87f282cfb8
 @config=
  #<ArchivesSpace::Configuration:0x00007f87f29e80c8
   @base_repo="",
   @base_uri="https://aspace-staging.princeton.edu/staff/api",
```

...and this cannot be resolved from the staging server:

```
[STAGING_HOST]:~$ curl -H "X-ArchivesSpace-Session: $SESSION" "https://aspace-staging.princeton.edu/staff/api/repositories/3/resource_descriptions/1769"
{"error":"Sinatra::NotFound"}
```

While I have forcibly-published this within the staging environment, this does not seem to have assisted:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/131882442-d236f0d3-867c-40b4-9b36-453e729a4456.png)

I will try and see about fixing the failing test before returning to this.

comments.body: I've messed with this a bunch - I don't think we can make the "relevance" sort do this. We could potentially add sort by "Folder Number" in the drop-down? Either way I'm not going to be able to get it in and shipped this week, so I'm putting this back in ready.
